N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 950.4 - Operation of vehicles

State Regulations
(a) No
person shall drive a motor vehicle on any portion of the vehicular crossing at
a speed greater than is reasonable and prudent under the conditions and having
regard to the actual and potential hazards then existing. (b) The limits specified or established
herein, except where a special hazard exists that requires lower speed for
compliance with the next preceding subdivision, shall be maximum lawful speed
and no person shall drive a vehicle on the vehicular crossing at a speed in
excess of such maximum limits. Rainbow Bridge

December 1 through March 31....... 15 miles per hour. April 1 through November 30....... 25 miles per hour. Whirlpool Rapids Bridge....... 15 miles per hour. Lewiston-Queenston Bridge

December 1 through March 31....... 25 miles per hour. April 1 through November 30....... 35 miles per hour. In truck yards and trailer areas 10 miles per hour unless
conditions as hereinabove stated are such that safety requires a speed of less
than 10 miles per hour. Nothing herein contained shall be construed to apply to
police and fire department vehicles, ambulances and to other emergency
vehicles. (c) Every person
shall obey the instructions of any official traffic control device applicable
to him, placed in accordance with these rules unless otherwise directed by a
bridge employee. (d) No person shall
fail or refuse to comply with any lawful order or direction of any bridge
employee. (e) All vehicles which
shall cross the bridges shall pay the toll as prescribed by section
950.2
of this Part, at the
regularly established places or booths for the collection of such
tolls. (f) No person shall stop, stand or park a vehicle upon any part of the vehicular crossing except: (1)
when necessary to avoid injury or damages
to persons or property; (2)
in
compliance with the direction of a bridge employee; (3)
while paying tolls; (4)
when disabled; (5)
in areas on the vehicular crossing
provided and marked by signs, striping or other devices marked for such
purposes; or
(6)
at designated
stopping points prior to customs and immigration and inspection
booths. (g) (1)

No person or persons shall leave a
vehicle unattended on the vehicular crossing except in case of emergency or in
the conduct of business with the commission, customs officials, immigration
officials, carriers or customs brokers, and then only in areas designated for
those purposes. (2)

When it is
permitted for a motor vehicle to stand unattended, no person driving or in
charge of such vehicle shall leave it so unattended without first stopping the
engine, effectively setting the brake thereon, and when standing upon any
grade, turning the front wheels to the curb or block the wheels. (h) No U turns shall be made on any
part of the vehicular crossing except under the direction of a bridge
employee. (i) No person shall make a
repair to a vehicle or change a tire thereon in or upon the vehicular crossing
unless authorized to do so by a bridge employee. (j) No person shall back a vehicle upon the
vehicular crossing unless such movement can be made with safety and without
interfering with other traffic. (k) No person shall drive a vehicle on the vehicular crossing using high beam
headlights. The flashing of headlights or sounding of horns on the vehicular
crossing is prohibited except when in the interest of safety such procedure is
required. (l) Upon the approach of
any ambulance, police or fire department vehicle, or upon the approach of the
commission vehicles giving adequate warning by means of siren or warning
lights, all traffic shall proceed as near as possible to the right hand curb on
the roadway and stop, unless and until otherwise directed by a bridge employee
or until such vehicle or vehicles shall have passed. (m) No person shall throw, dump or deposit or
place or cause to be thrown, dumped or deposited or placed upon the vehicular
crossing any refuse, litter or material of any kind and nature. (n) No person shall hitchhike in or upon the
vehicular crossing nor shall any person or persons congregate, stand, sit or
loiter in or upon the buildings or areas of the commission after a request by a
bridge employee to disperse. (o) No
person shall stand in or upon the vehicular crossing or any buildings or areas
of the commission to solicit from or sell to or deliver to any occupant of any
building or any vehicle upon the vehicular crossing, except with the written
permission of the commission, any type of goods or services. (p) No person shall teach or give
instructions in operating vehicles in or upon the vehicular
crossing. Notes
